title: Labour moderates aren't terrified that Corbyn will lose an election, but that he might win
text:
Theresa May is already escaping from the unfair reputation her opponents contrived for her during her short term as prime minister. Wiser heads are revisiting her achievement of negotiating a withdrawal deal from the EU that delivered Brexit while avoiding a hard border on the island of Ireland. More than one commentator has suggested that both Labour and DUP MPs might now be wishing they had offered May their support in the days of her greatest need.

But her most significant political achievement, the one that had the greatest ramifications for UK politics, is also one for which, ironically, she will not and cannot take credit. And it is shaping the latest argument between government and opposition...
description: Theresa May is already escaping from the unfair reputation her opponents contrived for her during her short term as prime minister.
